statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -4 \\ -4 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ -5 \\ -3 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ 0 \\ 0 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 11 \\ 5 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^4

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -4 \\ -4 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 1 \\ -5 \\ -3 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ 0 \\ 0 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ 11 \\ 5 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^4.
